sub_title: Head of Creatives - Creative Director at Hunkemöller | Strategy | Digital Integration | Human Xperiences | Tech | Leadership
summary:
Creative Director and Strategy Director
Currently leading @hunkemoller brand communications and campaigns. Helping activating brands into the digital future. Creating an authentic lifestyle experience. 

Specialties: 
Creative Direction; Branding & Omnichannel; Experience & Strategy;  Digital adoption & Phigital;
Human ON (Interactive, Mobile, App, Interactive Retail) - OFF (print, commercials, Brick & Mortar);
Art & Design direction; Concept development; Content and New Product .

Brands Experience:
Diesel,  Adidas, Tommy Hilfiger, deBijenkorf, CK, Axe, Balay, Fnac, Puma, MGM/United Artist, Heineken, Hilfiger Denim, Tommy Japan, Kia Motors, Mtv, Nickelodeon, Sealy, Cuatro Tv, Mutua Madrid Open Tenis, Atletico de Madrid, Satorisan

My work has been awarded and recognised with international prizes and nominations such as Fiap, Laus, FWA, Awwwards & Spin Awards.

projects.title: BARE JOURNAL - Fashion Magazine (Art Direction)
projects.description:
OPEN to VIEW, UNCONCEALED; UNADORNED; PLAIN

A journal of fashion and culture. Bare is a global fashion, culture and arts magazine dedicated to the unadorned moment of truth, an ode to the raw beauty of realism and simplicity.

Here you will find imagery, artistry, and storytelling with no creative brief, no client, no shimmer, no patina, no retouch - no rules.

Bare is free form and unmediated. Photographers direct their shoots. An architect considers his inspiration. Two filmmakers contemplate influences. A writer confesses. A designer delves into creative rituals. In these pages process is as fascinating as product. In Bare, our subjects tell their own stories. In this way our readers are free to draw their own conclusions. Bare is simple discovery without summary or synthesis.

Our first issue features unscripted explorations by some of our favorite photographers. Jem Mitchell goes into the wild. Billy Kidd searches the face. Kalle Gustafsson spends an afternoon on Stockholm's archipelago. Laurie Frankel transforms a home into a fanciful greenhouse. Chris Craymer reveals domestic, intimate hours. Barbara Iweins draws a bath.

Bare is independently published and owned. We live in Amsterdam, London, Paris, Barcelona, New York City, Berlin, Montana, Los Angeles and San Francisco.

projects.title: The Thinking Hut
projects.description:
The Thinking Hut(Link)
March 2013
Working, sharing, engaging, and creating together

The Thinking Hut is the materialized dream of a group of friends who go a long way (before the days of the internet bubble, and its burst). Their relationship has always circled around a common, shared space, which linked them for business and fun. During the Christmas of 2012, one of the members experienced a real physical need for space for his business and together with the rest, decided to put an end to the shortage of square meters while creating an environment where more people could feel comfortable working, sharing, engaging, and in essence, creating.

The Thinking Hut is located at the Mauristkade 55c. The building, dated 1912, once housed the stables for the breweries in the Amstel. Still today, it keeps many of those original features (high ceilings, steel columns, patterned windows...) that make it a solemn construction, with lots of character and charm.

The Thinking Hut is right by the North entrance of the Oosterpark (and after the planned renovations, we will literally be, IN the park!), so you can always go for a walk to search for inspiration or to have a break. Of course you can also opt for the wild hidden garden at the back.

However, if you need more information before then, do not be shy and contact us at: isaac@thethinkinghut.com or come by Mauritskade 55c during the 24H Oost (www.iamsterdam.com/24h) - Our door will be open from 12 to 2pm on the 23rd March and 11 to 12 on the 24th March. (Other times can also be arranged).

profile_positions.title: Head of Creatives - Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Brand experience generator - Leading & creating brands to become Future-proof, using digital first human centric experiences. 

Expertise; Global branding, Brand Strategy leading change, innovation & digital, customer experience and general management (Board /C-level). Strong capabilities to set distinctive vision for the company and lead the transformation of change with constant drive to deliver results. Creative Direction, Art & Design Direction; Digital Products;

High energy, moves fast, self starter, constantly looking for new ways, problem solver, original thinking, creative and entrepreneurial. EMEA & Global market knowledge, multi-cultural sensitivity and motivational leader.

Key differentiator is the Digital Transformation, amongst others the Multichannel approach, the switch to digital and enabling the change to customer engagement and customer centricity.

As Creative Director and Manager Director  I lead teams and projects from strategy & concept to front-end production. 

-Sepiia — Global Branding Strategy
-Diesel — Global Eyewear FW18 Campaign
-deBijenkorf — Fashion Exchange SS18 campaign
-Twona — International Rebranding
-Kaltblut — Fashion Film Editorial
-Diesel — Global Watches SS18 campaign
-deBijenkorf — Hello Beautiful Campaign
-Tommy Hilfiger — Tommy x Vetements Packaging
-deBijenkorf — Touch me campaign
-Tommy Hilfiger — Womenswear Trends
-deBijenkorf — SheStory Campaign
-Hilfiger Denim — Brand Digital Strategy & Omnichannel integration
-deBijenkorf — Social and Digital Content
-Satorisan — Global Omnichannel campaign

Consultancy CD & Brand  projects Include:
- Tommy Hilfiger, deBijenkorf, Axe, Hilfiger Denim, Adidas, Fossil, Diesel, Satorisan, Flavourspace.
- Tribal DDB, JWT, GREY Possible, Strawberry Frog, Isobar, JWT Retail/KSM  

Awards:

FWA SOTD - Hilfiger Denim (x2)
Spin Awards - Hilfiger Denim (Design)
